reviews.title: Great place!
reviews.text: Great place to stay....Modern building outside but its like and old finca inside! Even includes and adjacent republican house that has great late 1800's rooms! The average rate is about 75US! And I just got back and they had even a special for 45 dollars for a single! All shopping and bars and clubs of Miraflores, even the beaches, are within walking distance (1 to 6 blocks you find it all!), and me a gym freak there is a Gold's Gym half a block away and they give you low visit rates if you stayed there-just love it.....will keep on staying there since I go to Peru for work so often....all friendly people and english spoken by all front desk agents 24-7.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel, where we stayed for 2 nights, had its good and its bad sides...
reviews.title: Mixed experience

reviews.text: To start with the positive: we had the Republican Suite for 100$/night, which I think was a good deal because the room was really large with a very comfortable bed, mirror-wardrobe and otherwise quite nice furniture. But the real highlights of the suite were the sauna (ideal size for 2 people), which really was a treat, and the large, almost circular jacuzzi.

reviews.title: Very comfortable place to stay

reviews.text: The negative issue about this hotel is the staff, which had an "I couldn't care less" attitude. Normally the staff's friendliness is not so important to me, be the frontdesk at this hotel was exceptionally not-helpful e.g. when I asked them to help me reconfirm my next flight, and one guy even refused to talk to me in English (although I knew that he was able to).
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for about a week while doing research in Lima; Miraflores was an excellent base (easy bus ride, as long as you have your nerves, or by taxi), and the Hotel Ariosto was a friendly, comfortable, hospitable and economical place to stay (particularly for a single 30-something female traveler). Quite good Peruvian dinners (although there are plenty of other choices in the area), outstanding breakfast buffet, and an interesting vibe, which is what drew me there in the first place -- it seems to be the #1 choice for professional visitors, from basketball teams to writers & jazz musicians. Which always makes for interesting conversations. And the staff speaks excellent English. Rooms were large if a little spartan, and while internet access was available, it seems to be more available in some rooms than in others -- it took quite a bit of wrangling for them to give me a cable. Free shuttles to and from the airport are another plus, and the hotel has arrangements with trustworthy taxis for trips around the area.
reviews.title: Great base for visiting Lima

reviews.text: Hotel Ariosto (Miraflores): I stay at Hotel Ariosto (Av. La Paz 769 Miraflores, Lima 18-Peru) November 23 & 24. I paid $75 nightly. The accomodations were basic but acceptable. It is extremely clean. It is located in a good area and in a reletevaly quite neiborhood (Lima, in my humble opinion, is quite noisey). Since the $75 rate (which includes the 19% tax) included daily breakfast (the buffet is great); free use of the business center (with MS Word and internet), and transportation to-from airport, the rate is fair. I would stay once again. I hope the pictures are helpful.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with Great Service

reviews.text: The room was fine with a good shower and an unexceptional view of the street. Quite nice area- shops selling antiques and silverware. Reception was adequate. Lounge/dining area a bit dreary-heavy furniture . We were collected at the airport. The high spot was breakfast - with an extremely wide choice of interesting and well-cooked food.

Wonderful & excellent Breakfasts!
reviews.text: ROOMS: We got the large room on the 6th floor and it was heaven. Good bed, fridge, windows and very, very clean! The bathrooms were spotless. They buffed all tile floors almost daily. Very clean.

reviews.title: Worked for us
reviews.text: FOOD: The breakfast buffet is freshly prepared daily with authentic Peruvian breakfast dishes mixed in with typical American fare. The fresh, peeled fruit is layed out on a lovely platter and there is always enough to go back for seconds....or thirds! We stayed for an extended period of time because the Hotel was recommended to us by our family in Lima. They've lived in Lima for decades and insisted on only this Hotel. We were glad they did. The food was great and very well prepared. As in SOME places, the food is dicey and you have to be careful, but not at this Hotel. It caters to too many European and American business folks so the food is super safe ( and tasty).
